name: QC-Devs
description: Sustainable software for quantum chemistry & more

projects.summary: A project aimed at reorganizing the structure of the AtomDB database to enhance its efficiency and functionality.
This project focuses on optimizing the performance of the Gbasis package by implementing screening techniques to enhance speed and accuracy.
The aim here is to develop arbitrary-order overlap integrals in the GBasis package and explore their applications.

projects.project_name: Grid: Integration on the Sphere Using Maximum Determinant Points
projects.summary: This project will develop methods for integrating over spherical domains using maximum determinant points for increased computational accuracy.
The objective is to create adaptive quadrature methods within the Grid package for improved molecular calculations.
This project involves enhancing the Grid package with transformed cubic grids for more efficient computational geometry.

projects.project_name: Grid: Improve Robustness of Poisson Solver
projects.summary: Focusing on enhancing the reliability and stability of the Poisson solver used in the Grid package.

projects.project_name: ModelHamiltonian: Manipulating Model Hamiltonians and Building Interfaces to External Packages
projects.summary: Aimed at improving the functionality of Model Hamiltonian by allowing manipulation and better interfacing with external packages.

projects.project_name: ModelHamiltonian: An Alternative Approach to Spin Hamiltonians
projects.summary: The goal is to explore alternative methods for implementing spin Hamiltonians in the Model Hamiltonian package.

projects.project_name: NICE.jl: Add Exact Solver for Chemical Kinetics
projects.summary: This project aims to enhance the NICE.jl package by integrating an exact solver for chemical kinetics problems.

This document provides guidance for individuals interested in participating in the [Google Summer of Code (GSoC)](https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/) program with QC-Devs. We are looking forward to your contributions.

Project Ideas
-------------

We store project ideas as GitHub issues. The below links refer to these issues, where you can find more information about the package, the project, the task, and the expected outcomes. While QC-Devs supports quite a few packages (we released 7 in the last 12 months!), each year we select a few to focus on, as this makes it easier for mentors to engage with participants.
